content:
Now you are learning to write conditional graph queries for natural language questions. 
And conditional graph query function is:
def get_information(relation, tail_entity, head_entity, key, value):
"""
    This function retrieves information by querying a data source using a given relation and tail entity as search criteria.
    
    Args:
        relation (str): The relation to the query that matches the tail_entity or head_entity.
        tail_entity (str): The tail entity associated with the relation.
        head_entity (str): The head entity belongs to the relation.
        key (str):  The key to query that matches with time, it can be "time", "start_time", "end_time".
        value (str):  The value associated with or belongs to the key.
        
    Returns:
        list: A list of query results.
    """

Note: you need to use keep(set, value) to filter the results for before or after question and not use compare operator '>' '<' without keep function.

Your task is to break down the original natural language question step by step with given relations and annotations. Following are some examples.

Step1: Get the time of the EATCS award received by Moshe Vardi
Query1: "get_information(head_entity='Moshe Vardi', relation='award received', tail_entity='EATCS award', key='time')"

Step1: Get the time/year of the position held by Gordon Campbell, Baron Campbell of Croy in the 44th Parliament of the United Kingdom
Query1: "get_information(head_entity='Gordon Campbell, Baron Campbell of Croy', relation='position held', tail_entity='Member of the 44th Parliament of the United Kingdom', key='time')"
Step2: Get the min time/year of output_of_query1
Query2: "min(set=output_of_query1)"

Step1: Get the award received by Allan Edwall in 1981
Query1: "get_information(head_entity='Allan Edwall', relation='award received', key='time', value='1981')"

Step1: Get the time of member of sports team by Roberto Colombo
Query1: "get_information(head_entity='Roberto Colombo', relation='member of sports team', key='time')"
Step2: Get the first time output_of_query1
Query2: "min(set=output_of_query1)"
Step3: Get the name of team Roberto Colombo is member of sports team when the time is output_of_query2
Query3: "get_information(head_entity='Roberto Colombo', relation='member of sports team', key='time', value=output_of_query2)"

Step1: Get the time of member of sports team by Chris Lumsdon in Sunderland A.F.C.
Query1: "get_information(head_entity='Chris Lumsdon', relation='member of sports team', tail_entity='Sunderland A.F.C.', key='time')"
Step2: Get the players playing in Sunderland A.F.C. when the time is output_of_query1
Query2: "get_information(relation='member of sports team', tail_entity='Sunderland A.F.C.', key='time', value=output_of_query1)"

Question: Who held the position of {tail2} when Michael Matheson was the Member of the 3rd Scottish Parliament
Relations: ['position held']
Annotation: {'head': 'Michael Matheson', 'tail': 'Member of the 3rd Scottish Parliament'}, ['state treasurer']

Step1: Get the time of position held by Michael Matheson in the 3rd Scottish Parliament
Query1: "get_information(head_entity='Michael Matheson', relation='position held', tail_entity='Member of the 3rd Scottish Parliament', key='time')"
Step2: Get the people of position held is state treasurer when the time is output_of_query1
Query2: "get_information(relation='position held', tail_entity='state treasurer', key='time', value=output_of_query1)"

Step1: Get the time of position held by Sir John Leigh, 1st Baronet in the 33rd Parliament of the United Kingdom
Query1: "get_information(head_entity='Sir John Leigh, 1st Baronet', relation='position held', tail_entity='Member of the 33rd Parliament of the United Kingdom', key='time')"
Step2: Get the earliest/min time of output_of_query1
Query2: "min(set=output_of_query1)"

Step1: To get the after, find the time of 18th century
Query1: "get_information(head_entity='18th century', key='time')"
Step2: Find the max of output_of_query1
Query2: "max(set=output_of_query1)"
Step3: Get the time of position held is Member of the Swiss Federal Council
Query3: "get_information(relation='position held', tail_entity='Member of the Swiss Federal Council', key='time')"
Step4: Get the time of position held is Member of the Swiss Federal Council after output_of_query2
Query4: "keep(set=output_of_query3, value>output_of_query2)"
Step5: Get the first time of output_of_query4
Query5: "min(set=output_of_query4)"
Step6: Get the name of Member of the Swiss Federal Council when the time is output_of_query5
Query6: "get_information(relation='position held', tail_entity='Member of the Swiss Federal Council', key='time', value=output_of_query5)"

Step1: To get the before, find the time of Michael Gray in England national football team
Query1: "get_information(head_entity='Michael Gray', relation='member of sports team', tail_entity='England national football team', key='time')"
Step2: Find the min of output_of_query1
Query2: "min(set=output_of_query1)"
Step3: Get the time of Michael Gray is member of sports team
Query3: "get_information(head_entity='Michael Gray', relation='member of sports team', key='time')"
Step4: Get the time of output_of_query3 before output_of_query2
Query4: "keep(set=output_of_query3, value<output_of_query2)"
Step5: Get the last time of output_of_query4
Query5: "max(set=output_of_query4)"
Step6: Get the name of team Michael Gray is member of sports team when the time is output_of_query5
Query6: "get_information(head_entity='Michael Gray', relation='member of sports team', key='time', value=output_of_query5)"
